newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage rose 2.75 million barrels in the week ended August 8 to 312.16 million barrels from 309.41 million barrels the previous week, the American Petroleum Institute said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) rose 6.85 million barrels in the week to 255.20 million barrels.
Distillate stocks fell 745,000 barrels to 120.75 million barrels from 121.49 million barrels the prior week.
API said PADD 1 distillate stocks rose 1.52 million barrels to 49.78 million barrels.
API said gasoline production rose 144,000 barrels per day in the week to 7.92 million bpd from 7.78 million bpd in the prior week.
Gasoline stocks fell 863,000 barrels in the week to 191.06 million barrels from 191.93 million.
Percent of stocks capacity fell to 95.0 percent from 97.1 percent the prior week.
API said reformulated gasoline stocks (RFG) fell 2.20 million barrels to 37.31 million barrels from 39.52 million barrels the previous week.
API also said refinery operating rate excluding PADD 5 rose to 103.5 percent in the week from 102.2 percent the previous week.
Crude runs to processing units fell to 14.68 million barrels per day from 15.00 million the previous week.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week rose to 36.43 million barrels from 36.33 million in the previous week.
Crude oil imports rose to 9.00 million barrels per day from 7.79 million.
